column8: An application letter by the Penang state water concessionaire to the national regulatory body to raise water tariffs proved that it was the Penang government that had earlier given the go-ahead for the hike, Gerakan said.Its secretary-general Datuk Liang Teck Meng said the letter submitted by Penang Water Supply Corpo­ration (PBAPP) to the National Water Services Commission (SPAN) would reveal who was the real party that wanted to implement a “broad and big” increase in water rates.He challenged Penang Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng to allow him to publicise this letter dated Dec 23, 2016.“I take great offence over Lim’s statement, which accused me of hinting that the Federal Government wanted Penang to increase its water rates in line with other states.“This is a pure slander against me by the Chief Minister,” Liang said in a statement yesterday.Liang, who is also SPAN chairman, said the planned increase aimed to collect more than RM150mil a year from Penangites and businesses in order to save PBAPP from running into losses due to ballooning expenditure.He added that before DAP came into power in 2008, Penang was already enjoying the lowest water rates and the lowest non-revenue water rates in the country.Therefore, credit should be given to the previous Barisan Nasional government in Penang for the lowest water rates despite the four increases in water tariffs by the current state government since 2010, Liang said.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...qw2V4kQrGoc3.99
